column6: New employee hires and employee turnover
column13: MinRes attended and sponsored the United Kingdom (UK) Down Under Live international recruitment expos in Birmingham and London in October 2022. The visit presented an opportunity to connect with UK-based recruitment agencies and present career prospects to 1,200 event attendees.
column20: Down Under Live, recruitment expo, recruitment agency

column6: New employee hires and employee turnover
column13: MinRes delivered the campaign "The Work. The Lifestyle" via the Australia and NZ Magazine, social media and event branding. The first hire commenced work in 2023 as an electrician for CSI Mining Services (CSI).
column20: The Work, The Lifestyle, event branding, CSI

column6: New employee hires and employee turnover
column13: MinRes continued to grow its Career Entry Pathways, including apprenticeships, traineeships, entry-level dump truck operator training, work experience, and graduate and vacation programs designed to attract new entry-level talent to MinRes.
column20: Career Entry Pathways, apprenticeship, traineeship

column6: New employee hires and employee turnover
column13: The MinRes Graduate Program is a 24-month structured, internally developed and assessed across site and office-based rotations. MinRes' FY23 intake welcomed 24 graduates, taking its total to 50 graduates. MinRes' graduates span a variety of technical and support service disciplines, including engineering (mining, process, and mechanical), geology, finance, health, land access and heritage, and safety and environment.
column20: MinRes Graduate Program, engineering, finance

column6: New employee hires and employee turnover
column13: In FY23, MinRes reviewed and relaunched its Vacation Program. This structured 12-week program, held during the summer, actively involves undergraduate students in their final year of university studies. During FY23, MinRes welcomed 18 students, each of whom had the opportunity to contribute to at least one significant project throughout their 12-week placement.
column20: Vacation Program, undergraduate student, university study

column6: New employee hires and employee turnover
column8: KIC Introduction to Careers in Industry
column13: CSI Mining Services (CSI), a wholly-owned subsidiary of MinRes, is an associate member of the KIC and has a long history of supporting the growth, development, and sustainability of businesses in the Kwinana industrial area. The KIC Introduction to Careers in Industry is a two-year program designed for females to encourage greater diversity in the industry. Students undertake the program during Years 11 and 12 alongside their school studies. By supporting this program, MinRes aims to create a talent pipeline of female apprentices for future intakes of its Apprenticeship Program.
column20: KIC Introduction to Careers in Industry, Kwinana industrial area, school study

column6: Benefits provided to full-time employees that are not provided to temporary or part-time employees
column13: MinRes conducted an employee engagement survey for the second year to gain insights into what matters most to its people. The survey had a response rate of 76 per cent, providing valuable data that has informed numerous initiatives designed to increase retention.
column20: Employee engagement survey, retention, insight

column6: Parental leave
column13: During FY23, MinRes launched its new Parental Leave Guideline to demonstrate its family values and recognise all family types at MinRes. The notable changes to parental leave included the terminology changes from pregnant employees to primary and secondary carers and removing the 12-month waiting period.
column20: Parental Leave Guideline, family value, primary carer, secondary carer

column6: Minimum notice periods regarding operational changes
column13: During FY23, MinRes commenced construction on the Onslow Iron project, the future site of resort-style accommodation. This camp aims to set a new standard for FIFO accommodation by supporting couples, creating a safe working environment, and promoting employee health and well-being.
column20: Onslow Iron project, resort-style accommodation, health and well-being

column6: Occupation health and safety management system
column8: MinRes Health and Safety Management System
column13: The MinRes Health and Safety Management System is designed to establish a clear set of values and objectives to reduce the likelihood and severity of incidents and ensure conformance with regulatory and Company requirements for managing workplace health and safety. The system is tailored to meet the Company's specific needs and assist MinRes business units and their operations in effectively managing health and safety by executing established Company policies, standards, and procedures.
column20: MinRes Health and Safety Management System, health, safety

column6: Hazard identification, risk assessment, and incident investigation
column13: The MinRes Hazard and Risk Management Procedure defines minimum requirements to identify, analyse, evaluate, control, monitor and review occupational hazards and risks within the business. Definitions of risk consequence levels, likelihood, risk ratings and a hierarchy of controls ensure consistent application across the business.
column20: Hazard and Risk Management Procedure, occupational hazard, risk consequence

column6: Hazard identification, risk assessment, and incident investigation
column13: MinRes identifies all principal mining hazards (PMH) specific to its operations following new provisions in the Work Health and Safety (WHS) Mines Regulations 2022. To provide a consistent approach for identifying and assessing a PMH, MinRes has created a Principal Mining Hazard Management Plan framework for implementation across its mining operations.
column20: Principal Mining Hazard Management Plan, WHS Mines Regulation, principal mining hazard

column6: Hazard identification, risk assessment, and incident investigation
column13: Effective health risk management enables MinRes to identify priority areas for resource allocation and meet the standards and expectations of its stakeholders. MinRes completed Companywide health risk assessments to oversee material and non-material health risks. MinRes' minimum controls support critical health risk management and drive risk reduction actions to protect its people from harm.
column20: Health risk assessment, health risk, health risk management

column6: Occupational health services
column13: MinRes is committed to complying with all health and safety laws and regulations governing its activities. MinRes developed comprehensive policies, standards and procedures to guide compliance. MinRes' Health and Safety Policy is supported by a suite of policies such as the Injury Management Policy and Fitness for Work Policy, which lay the foundation of MinRes' safety management framework Ã¢ÂÂ supported by cascading standards, procedures, plans and tools to meet the requirements of the Mine Safety and Inspection Act 1994 and the Mines Safety and Inspection Regulations 1995.
column20: Health and Safety Policy, health and safety law, Fitness for Work Policy

column6: Occupational health services
column13: MinRes has a dedicated Health Services team that supports employee health and well-being across the full spectrum of health services. MinRes' health and well-being program strengthens its focus on supporting its people by providing end-to-end services to suit individual needs.
column20: Health Services team, health and well-being, health service

column6: Occupational health services
column13: MinRes undertakes baseline medical assessments of physical, hearing, and lung function to establish medical fitness for work before employment. Across all sites, MinRes established monitoring programs to assess potential exposures to health hazards. These programs assist in developing health exposure risk profiles and associated controls, ensuring the prevention of occupational illness.
column20: Baseline medical assessment, lung function, medical fitness

column6: Occupational health services
column13: In FY23, the MinRes Health Services team developed the Health Monitoring Program to identify changes in employee health status due to workplace exposures such as dust and noise. To determine the workgroups requiring health monitoring, the Health Services team undertook risk and exposure assessments to ensure MinRes' people are supported in the early identification and treatment of potential occupational-related diseases.
column20: Health Monitoring Program, health status, workplace exposure

column6: Occupational health services
column13: MinRes' in-house Psychologist continued the development of MinRes' mental health strategy, programs and initiatives. It includes access for all employees and their families to MinRes' Employee Assistance Program (EAP), which provides confidential professional counselling and support to employees with personal or work-related difficulties.
column20: Employee Assistance Program, mental health strategy, professional counseling

column6: Occupational health services
column13: In October 2022, MinRes opened the MinRes Health Centre to deliver free holistic health care for its employees. The state-of-the-art facilities at MinRes' headquarters reflect its commitment to becoming a leader in workplace well-being, supporting them in all their health needs.
column20: MInRes Health Centre, health care, workplace well-being

column6: Worker participation, consultation, and communication on occupational health and safety
column13: The MinRes Board provides oversight of the health and safety strategy and performance as an essential aspect of MinRes' corporate governance structure, ensuring the well-being of employees and stakeholders. It enables the identification of areas for concern, assessment of control effectiveness and up-to-date management of emerging risks, evolving regulatory requirements and industry best practices.
column20: Health and safety strategy oversight, well-being, emerging risk

column6: Worker participation, consultation, and communication on occupational health and safety
column13: MinRes' Job Dictionary Project aims to enhance workforce collaboration, innovation and operational efficiency by reviewing 20 high-risk and safety-critical roles across MinRes operations. The project will assist in identifying suitable duties for injured or ill employees, support pre-employment screening criteria, job-person matching and determining key psychosocial risk areas within the business.
column20: Job Dictionary Project, workforce collaboration, psychosocial risk

column6: Worker participation, consultation, and communication on occupational health and safety
column13: A specific focus of the coaching team has been to partner with the Leadership Essentials program by providing practical and consistent coaching support for the program participants. This support has included on-site coaching support and well-being discussions with frontline leaders when they are located at MinRes headquarters for program delivery.
column20: Leadership Essentials, coaching team, coaching support

column6: Worker training on occupational health and safety
column13: MinRes maintains a Lessons Learnt process that applies to all serious incidents, intending to consistently share learnings identified through MinRes' investigation processes across the organisation. It ensures all stakeholders are appropriately informed of the hazards in the workplace and understand the actions that need to be implemented to ensure that risks are controlled and incidents are not repeated.
column20: Lessons Learnt, investigation process, serious incident

column6: Worker training on occupational health and safety
column13: All MinRes operations include a robust health and safety induction program for all employees, contractors, subcontractors and visitors. It overviews MinRes' business, vision and values, key MinRes policies and procedures, and critical health, safety and environmental information.
column20: Health and safety induction, health, safety, environmental information

column6: Worker training on occupational health and safety
column13: In FY23, MinRes delivered Psychosocial Hazard Awareness training for 2,299 employees, supporting them in identifying, reporting and managing psychosocial hazards. A virtual module complemented this to support new employees in understanding psychosocial hazards in the context of mining operations at MinRes.
column20: Psychosocial Hazard Awareness training, psychosocial hazard, virtual module

column6: Worker training on occupational health and safety
column13: As part of its strategy to reduce stigma in the workplace, MinRes trained 92 Mental Health First Aiders. MinRes also deployed a Peer Support Program and suicide prevention strategies to support all employees. It supports MinRes' strategic goal to ensure psychosocial hazards are managed in line with regulatory requirements.
column20: Mental Health First Aiders, Peer Support Program, suicide prevention

column6: Promotion of worker health
column13: MinRes empowers its people to speak up when they don't feel safe and report all hazards identified in the workplace. MinRes' stop work authority empowers workers to stop any unsafe work. Stop work authority is actively promoted and encouraged through the MinRes Communication and Consultation Procedure and during all safety inductions, emphasising the responsibility and obligation of all employees and contractors to stop working if they perceive a hazard, unsafe conditions or behaviours that may present danger to personnel, equipment or the environment.
column20: Communication and Consultation Procedure, safety induction, unsafe condition

column6: Promotion of worker health
column13: A weekly safety and training notification is sent to all operational teams with internal safety alerts and other health, safety and training notifications. It includes toolbox topic documents for discussion at pre-start and toolbox meetings for the following week. Toolbox topics have included identifying, assessing and controlling risks, electrical awareness, road safety, noise-induced hearing loss, tyre fires and explosions, isolation and tagging, and sustaining nightshift and fatigue.
column20: The safety and training notification, a toolbox meeting, electrical awareness

column6: Prevention and mitigation of occupational health and safety impacts directly linked by business relationships
column13: In FY23, MinRes expanded its Safe and Respectful Behaviours program to include in-person Stop for Safety sessions across all teams. The sessions address psychosocial hazards, outline the expectations of leaders and employees and inform employees of the various reporting channels.
column20: Stop for Safety, Safe and Respectful Behaviour, psychosocial hazard

column6: Prevention and mitigation of occupational health and safety impacts directly linked by business relationships
column8: Crisis and Emergency Response Management Plan
column13: MinRes has a Crisis and Emergency Response Management Plan (CERMP) formulated to provide a comprehensive framework for swift and decisive actions during emergencies. The CERMP defines roles, responsibilities and arrangements to activate a rapid and organised response to emergencies or crises. These may include cyclones, security issues, fatalities, significant environmental damage, kidnappings, accidents and destruction of assets.
column20: Crisis and Emergency Response Management Plan, emergency, security issue

column6: Prevention and mitigation of occupational health and safety impacts directly linked by business relationships
column13: MinRes' contracting partners are an important part of its workforce and are integral to the safe delivery of a high-quality product to its customers. The MinRes Contractor Management Procedure outlines the process for verifying that contractor and subcontractor groups have the necessary skills, resources, and equipment to undertake work activities assigned by MinRes safely.
column20: Contractor Management Procedure, safe delivery, work activity
